According to the results of the 2024 European Parliament elections, the composition of the next European Parliament is as follows: - Group of the European People’s Party (EPP): 189 seats. - Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament (S&D): 135 seats. - Renew Europe Group (Renew): 79 seats. - European Conservatives and Reformists Group (ECR): 73 seats. - Identity and Democracy Group (ID): 58 seats. - Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance (Greens/EFA): 53 seats. - The Left Group in the European Parliament – GUE/NGL (Left-GUE/NGL): 36 seats. It is clear that the Greens/EFA group, with 53 seats, does not hold the most seats. The EPP group holds the most seats with 189 seats. Therefore, based on the official results and credible media reports, the question can be resolved.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, we need to examine the available information up to the resolution date of July 23, 2024.

    From the sources provided:
    - A letter circulated by House Democrats, including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Quigley, and Susan Wild, opposes the DNC's plan for a virtual roll call to nominate Biden early. This letter is part of a broader effort by House Democrats to express their concerns about Biden's candidacy and the nomination process.
    - The letter has garnered support from over 20 individuals, including several House Democrats. Specifically, it is mentioned that "over 20 individuals including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild" have signed the letter.

    Given this information, it is clear that the criteria for resolving the question positively have been met. The letter has been signed by more than 20 House Democrats, which satisfies the condition set out in the question.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

This question will resolve as **Yes** if both of the following conditions are met: (a) Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and (b) Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Glenn Youngkin will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election and if Larry Elder will not be the nominee, we need to examine the available information up to the resolution date of 2024-08-01.

    From the sources provided:
    - Glenn Youngkin has been mentioned as a potential figure in Republican politics, but there is no indication that he is running for the presidential nomination. Instead, he has been focused on his role as Virginia's governor and has endorsed Donald Trump for the presidency.
    - There have been efforts by some anti-Trump conservative donors to encourage Youngkin to run for president, but Youngkin has not committed to doing so and has stated his focus is on Virginia.
    - The Republican National Convention has already taken place, and Donald Trump has been selected as the nominee. Trump announced Ohio Senator JD Vance as his running mate, not Glenn Youngkin.

    Regarding Larry Elder, there is no mention in the provided sources that he is a contender for the Republican presidential nomination in 2024.

    Given this information, it is clear that Glenn Youngkin is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, and there is no indication that Larry Elder was ever in the running.

question.body:

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:

    For Larry Elder:

    - Given that he has dropped out of the race, it is clear that Larry Elder will not be the Republican nominee.

    For Glenn Youngkin:
    - There is no mention in the provided sources of Glenn Youngkin running for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination. The sources focus on Larry Elder and other candidates who have either dropped out or are still in the race.
    - Without any information indicating that Glenn Youngkin has entered the race or has any significant chance of becoming the nominee, we cannot conclude that he will be the nominee.

    Since Larry Elder has dropped out and there is no evidence that Glenn Youngkin is a candidate, we can resolve the question based on the available information.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Donald Trump will be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, we need to look at the current state of the Republican primaries and the nomination process.

    According to the sources provided:
    - Donald Trump was the first candidate of either party to formally announce a 2024 bid and launched his campaign in November 2022.
    - After Super Tuesday, Trump was the last major Republican candidate left in the race, and he accepted the Republican presidential nomination at the party's convention in Milwaukee.
    - Trump selected Ohio Sen. JD Vance as his running mate.

    Given this information, it is clear that Donald Trump has been selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the Democrats will have a brokered convention in 2024, we need to understand what a brokered convention is and the current state of the Democratic nomination process.

    A brokered convention occurs when a party's nominee is not selected by a majority in the first round of delegate voting, requiring additional rounds of voting.

    As of the provided sources, the Democratic National Convention has already concluded, and Joe Biden has been officially nominated as the Democratic presidential nominee. The sources indicate that there were no indications or reports of a need for multiple rounds of voting to nominate Biden.

    Given that the convention has taken place and Biden was nominated without the need for multiple ballots, we can conclude that a brokered convention did not occur.

    Therefore, based on the available information, the question can be resolved.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the question can be resolved, we need to examine two key components:

    ### Component (a): At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early

    - According to the sources, there were multiple letters and statements from House Democrats opposing the early nomination plan. For instance, a letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman and signed by over 20 individuals, including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild, expressed concerns about the virtual roll call vote.
    - This indicates that the criteria of at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signing a public letter opposing the early nomination plan have been met.

    ### Component (b): Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024

    - A brokered convention is defined as a situation where more than one round of voting is required to formally nominate the candidate.
    - Given the context, President Biden announced on Sunday that he is stepping aside from running in the 2024 presidential race, which significantly alters the nomination process.
    - However, the sources do not provide definitive information on whether the nomination process after Biden's announcement would require only one round of voting or more. The focus has been on the internal conflicts and the calls for Biden to step aside rather than the specifics of the convention process post-announcement.

    Since we have clear evidence that at least 20 House/Senate Democrats signed a public letter opposing the early nomination plan, but lack definitive information on whether the Democratic convention will be brokered or not, the question cannot be fully resolved based on the available data.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the resolution of the question, we need to evaluate both conditions (a) and (b). Condition (a) is satisfied as multiple House Democrats signed a public letter opposing the early nomination of Biden, reaching at least 20 signatures. Condition (b) is also satisfied as Biden's withdrawal from the race indicates the Democratic Party did not have a brokered convention. Since both conditions are met, the question resolves as YES.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if Donald Trump will testify at the hush money trial, we need to look at the available information up to the resolution date of June 15, 2024.

    From the sources provided:

    This indicates that as of the time the defense rested, Donald Trump had not testified in the trial.

    Given this information, we can conclude that by the resolution date of June 15, 2024, Donald Trump did not testify at the hush money trial.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, midnight ET, and (b) Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(a) This part will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. A "military action" is defined as any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions, but excludes cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions. Only actions explicitly claimed by Iran or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count. Proxy force attacks do not count.

(b) This part will resolve to "Yes" if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, neither in person nor remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To resolve this forecasting question, we need to examine two distinct parts: (a) whether Iran initiates a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024, and (b) whether Donald Trump testifies at the hush money trial.

    ### Part (a): Iran's Military Action on Israeli Territory
    - The sources provided indicate that on April 13, 2024, Iran initiated a significant military action against Israel. This action included the launch of drones, cruise missiles, and ballistic missiles toward Israel and the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights.
    - This event occurred well before the specified date range of July 30 to August 12, 2024, but it does satisfy the condition of Iran initiating a military action on Israeli territory.
    - Therefore, part (a) of the question can be resolved to "Yes" based on the available information.

    ### Part (b): Donald Trump's Testimony at the Hush Money Trial
    - The sources provided do not contain any information about Donald Trump's involvement in the hush money trial or whether he has testified.
    - Since there is no relevant data on this aspect, we cannot determine whether Donald Trump has testified or not.
    - Therefore, part (b) of the question cannot be resolved based on the available information.

    Given that one part of the question can be resolved affirmatively but the other part cannot be resolved at all, the overall question cannot be definitively answered.

second_call_metadata.chain_of_thought: To determine the resolution of the question, we evaluated both parts (a) and (b). For part (a), there was no evidence that Iran initiated a military action on Israeli territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, so it resolves to No. Part (b) could not be determined based on the sources provided, but since part (a) is No, the overall question also resolves to No. Therefore, my final output is 0.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels; or (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market. Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

    To resolve this, we need to look at the polling data around that date. However, the provided sources do not include the specific 538 national polling average data for July 15, 2024.

    The sources provided include various polls and their results, but they do not specify the 538 national polling average, which is the critical metric for resolving this question.

    For example, the Emerson College Polling data shows Trump leading Biden by 3 percentage points in some polls around that time, but this does not reflect the 538 national polling average.

    Since the specific data from 538's national polling average for July 15, 2024, is not available in the provided sources, we cannot definitively resolve this question.

Although these sources give us some insight, the exact 538's national polling average for that specific date was not directly found. question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

    According to the provided sources, Will Hurd announced his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination on June 22, 2023.

    However, subsequent reports indicate that Will Hurd suspended his presidential campaign on October 9, 2023, and endorsed Nikki Haley instead.

Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. 2. Elon Musk does not become a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

    According to the provided sources, the Indiana Pacers reached the Eastern Conference Finals in 2024 but were swept by the Boston Celtics in the series.

    Specifically, the Boston Celtics clinched the Eastern Conference championship with a 105-102 win over the Indiana Pacers, sweeping the series 4-0 and booking a spot in the NBA Finals.

    Since the Pacers were eliminated in the Eastern Conference Finals and did not advance to the NBA Finals, they cannot win the 2024 NBA Finals.

    Therefore, based on the available information, the question can be resolved.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought: To determine if the Greens–EFA political group will hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections, we need to look at the election results. According to the results of the 2024 European Parliament elections, the composition of the next European Parliament is as follows: - Group of the European People’s Party (EPP): 189 seats. - Group of the Progressive Alliance of Socialists and Democrats in the European Parliament (S&D): 135 seats. - Renew Europe Group (Renew): 79 seats. - European Conservatives and Reformists Group (ECR): 73 seats. - Identity and Democracy Group (ID): 58 seats. - Group of the Greens/European Free Alliance (Greens/EFA): 53 seats. - The Left Group in the European Parliament – GUE/NGL (Left-GUE/NGL): 36 seats. It is clear that the Greens/EFA group, with 53 seats, does not hold the most seats. The EPP group holds the most seats with 189 seats. Therefore, based on the official results and credible media reports, the question can be resolved.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, we need to examine the available information up to the resolution date of July 21, 2024.

    From the sources provided:
    - There is a mention of a letter being circulated by House Democrats, including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild, opposing the DNC's plan for a 'virtual roll call' to nominate Biden early. This is reported in multiple sources.
    - The letter expresses concerns about stifling debate and prematurely finalizing the Democratic ticket through an unprecedented 'virtual roll call.' It is stated that over 20 individuals, including several representatives, have signed or are set to sign this letter.
    - Specifically, it is mentioned that "at least 19 Capitol Hill Democrats have publicly called on Biden to step back from the race" and that the letter has been signed by "over 20 individuals".
    - Additionally, there are reports of multiple Democratic lawmakers expressing their opposition to the early nomination plan, which aligns with the criteria of multiple letters combining to reach a total of 20 signatures.

    Given this information, it is clear that the criteria for the market to resolve YES have been met. There are more than 20 Democratic lawmakers who have signed or are set to sign letters opposing the early nomination plan.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if at least 20 House or Senate Democrats will sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, we need to examine the available information up to the resolution date of July 23, 2024.

    From the sources provided:
    - A letter circulated by House Democrats, including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Quigley, and Susan Wild, opposes the DNC's plan for a virtual roll call to nominate Biden early. This letter is part of a broader effort by House Democrats to express their concerns about Biden's candidacy and the nomination process.
    - The letter has garnered support from over 20 individuals, including several House Democrats. Specifically, it is mentioned that "over 20 individuals including Reps. Jared Huffman, Mike Levin, and Susan Wild" have signed the letter.

    Given this information, it is clear that the criteria for resolving the question positively have been met. The letter has been signed by more than 20 House Democrats, which satisfies the condition set out in the question.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if at least 5 countries won their debut gold medal at the 2024 Olympics, we need to examine the available information about countries that achieved their first-ever Olympic gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

    From the sources provided:
    - Dominica won its first-ever Olympic gold medal through Thea LaFond in the women's triple jump.
    - Saint Lucia also won its first Olympic gold medal, with Julien Alfred securing gold in the women's 100 meters and silver in the 200 meters.
    - Albania did not win a gold medal but won its first-ever Olympic medals, which were bronze medals in wrestling.
    - Cabo Verde won its first-ever Olympic medal, which was a bronze medal in boxing, not a gold medal.
    - The Refugee Olympic Team won its first-ever Olympic medal, which was a bronze medal in boxing, not a gold medal.

    Additionally, other countries achieved notable firsts:
    - Botswana's Letsile Tebogo won the 200-meter athletics event, which is Botswana's first Olympic gold medal.
    - Guatemala's Adriana Ruano Oliva won a gold medal in shooting, marking Guatemala's first Olympic gold medal.

    Combining these pieces of information:
    - Dominica (Thea LaFond)
    - Saint Lucia (Julien Alfred)
    - Botswana (Letsile Tebogo)
    - Guatemala (Adriana Ruano Oliva)

    These are four countries that won their first-ever Olympic gold medals. There is no mention of a fifth country achieving this milestone in the provided sources.

    Therefore, based on the available information, the question cannot be resolved as true because there is no evidence of at least 5 countries winning their debut gold medal.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

metadata.resolver_chain_of_thought:
To determine if the Prime Minister of France will belong to a coalition other than the New Popular Front (NFP) or Together (Ensemble) on July 30, 2024, we need to analyze the current political situation in France based on the provided sources.

    From the sources, it is clear that the 2024 French legislative elections resulted in a hung parliament, with no single party or coalition achieving a majority. The NFP won the most seats but fell short of a majority, securing 180-188 seats depending on the source.

    President Emmanuel Macron refused to appoint a prime minister from the NFP, citing that such a government would face an immediate vote of no confidence and be unable to function effectively.

    On August 27, 2024, Macron appointed Michel Barnier as the Prime Minister, who is not a member of the NFP or the far-right National Rally (RN), but rather associated with the center-right and previously with the Ensemble coalition.

    Given this information, as of the current date (August 2024), the Prime Minister of France, Michel Barnier, does not belong to the NFP or the far-right RN, but is associated with a more center-right alignment, which aligns with the Ensemble coalition or other center-right forces.

    Therefore, the question can be resolved based on the available data.
